properties.notes: This restaurant replaced 3579 Studio
La Grotta Italian Restaurant replaced Hidden Paradise Café. http://missionlocal.org/2012/04/la-grotta-italian-restaurant-to-open-on-22nd-and-bartlett/

The storefront has been vacant since 2007 and family members of the owners own the residential hotel located below. This will be a boxing gym. http://missionlocal.org/2012/03/boxing-gym-coming-to-mission-street/

Will serve American food. This full service restaurant with full bar will replace the Bombay Baazar and Bombay Ice Creamery. http://missionlocal.org/2011/06/the-latest-valencia-food-trend-is-liquid-cocktails/
properties.expected opening date: Intended to open on May 5th (Cinco de Mayo)

properties.notes:
El Tomate will replace the former American food restaurant known as Izalco Restaurant.
http://missionlocal.org/2011/09/discolandia-sign-stays-two-new-restaurants-in-the-works/

Amber Dara will be located in a space that has been vacant for approximately 10 years. Previously 680 Valencia was used as a retail grocery and specialty food store. 
http://missionlocal.org/2011/05/valencias-vacancies-and-new-venues/

Juhu Beach Club will replace Allan Milkerit Books.
http://missionlocal.org/2012/01/top-chef-alum-plans-to-open-indian-restaurant-on-mission-street/

Heath Ceramics will take over a vacant industrial building on Florida and 18th Streets.
http://missionlocal.org/2011/09/manufacturing-moving-to-the-mission-promises-jobs/
properties.expected opening date: Retail & Tile Showroom Opening: Summer 2012, Tile Manufacturing Opening: Fall 2012

properties.notes:
This property was last home to John’s Jaguars auto shop. As for the space, the building was originally one address and has now been split into three. The other two neighbors will be Abbot's Cellar and William Werner's new pastry place. Dandelion has the new space on the north side of the building
http://missionlocal.org/2011/11/start-up-sells-for-millions-founders-turn-to-chocolate/

The old New College building will be divided into different sections, which will include a music home for jazz band and cafes. The Chapel will be an upscale restaurant that will be serving New Orleans and Southern food.
http://missionlocal.org/2011/05/valencias-vacancies-and-new-venues/

This upcoming café will offer more casual dining and replace the old New College Building.
http://missionlocal.org/2011/05/valencias-vacancies-and-new-venues/

If all goes well, Pollo Campero will replace the former Payless Shoe Source.
http://missionlocal.org/2011/04/despite-foes-pollo-campero-tries-to-move-in/
Sixth Course will be an artisan sweet shop located in a residential building. http://missionlocal.org/2012/01/artisan-desserts-shop-planned-for-15th-street/
properties.expected opening date: Waiting on permit approvals and hope to be open early winter or shortly after the new year.

properties.notes:
The new Fresh & Easy will replace a Delano’s grocery store.
http://missionlocal.org/2012/02/proposed-fresh-easy-decision-postponed/
http://missionlocal.org/2012/03/medjool-owner-goes-to-pot/

St. Vincent will replace the former Heart.
http://insidescoopsf.sfgate.com/blog/2011/12/12/heart-closes-as-scheduled-st-vincent-en-route/
http://sf.eater.com/archives/2012/03/07/st_vincent_bean_spillage_david_lynch_and_chef_bill_niles_tell_all.php
http://missionlocal.org/2011/06/garage-based-brewery-uses-kickstarter-to-make-a-bid-for-the-big-time/
properties.expected opening date: Still looking for an adequate space in the Mission, date unknown.

properties.notes:
This former vacant lot will now be the site of a 40-unit building.
http://missionlocal.org/2011/07/between-cathedral-and-armory-more-condos/

This property will replace the former gas station lot with a 58-foot tall mixed-use building with 40 residential units.
http://missionlocal.org/2011/10/planned-condos-for-15th-street-may-get-approval/

These condos will be placed in a vacant 20-foot tall commercial building. 
http://missionlocal.org/2010/12/20-new-condos-proposed-for-harrison-street/

The 45,000 square foot parcel includes a planned development for 95 residential units and 14,000 square feet of retail in 8 stories plus the rehabilitation and reuse of a historic single-screen theater known as the New Mission Theater. 
http://missionlocal.org/2012/02/after-long-delay-city-approves-locals-corner/

Pig and Pie will replace Discolandia Record Store, but keep their original sign. 
http://missionlocal.org/2011/09/discolandia-sign-stays-two-new-restaurants-in-the-works/

It’s a proposed pub that will take over the former Salon Mirabelle. 
http://missionlocal.org/2012/02/pub-in-the-works-at-15th-and-mission-streets/

Restaurant Cyan will replace Valencia Interiors space.
http://missionlocal.org/2011/05/valencias-vacancies-and-new-venues/
